text:
The White House national climate advisor is a proposed government job within the White House Office. It will officially be created when President-elect Joe Biden is inaugurated on January 20, 2021.
The advisor will work as the president's chief advisor on domestic climate change policy, and will lead the White House Office of Domestic Climate Policy.
On December 14, 2020, it was announced that Gina McCarthy, the former administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency under President Barack Obama, would be the first national climate advisor. The New York deputy secretary of energy and environment, Ali Zaidi, will be deputy national climate advisor.
